Sorry it�s taken me so long to reply, people. I was out doing Christmas 
shopping.

* Diana giggled as she watched Rion fall over onto his back, swinging her 
tail merrily as she walked up to him a bit.
She wore a smile from ear to fuzzy ear, prancing in the sand where she 
stood. Glad to find that they were together and weren�t split apart, still 
with her best friends, still on this planet.
But then she looked at Rion more closely as he stood up and took balance, 
noticing a small little glint in his eyes.
She knew that glint!
Rion was up to something, and Diana gave him a determined little smile and 
narrowed her eyes as she braced herself. He was good at play fighting, but 
so was she!
Her tail swung behind her like a kitten that had zoned in on a ball of yarn.
Diana gave a little playful yowl�the best she could manage at a roar to 
early in her life, as Rion ran and tried to tackle her. She took the brunt 
of the weight with her shoulders but her back legs sank in the sand and she 
found herself toppling backward and onto her back.
She gave another yowl as she opened her eyes and batted at Rion playfully, 
trying to push his shoulders back so that she could flip him over but not 
extending her claws.
Since, in their past combat training, Rion was using his feet to push his 
weight down on her, she would have to weaken or get rid of that base of 
support.
With her back legs Diana swung them a bit to dig into the sand and under his 
feet, then bringing them up right under them to catch him by surprise and 
maybe topple him.
Get an enemy off their feet and they�re almost helpless! *

� Betcha� I can!�
